data.text: @golddomersdulac But the most random thing that ever happened was being rudely awoken early in the morning after a night of partying by someone throwing a full can of Coke at my stomach, saying "drink this, we're balling in 5 min", and then having to play a hungover game of basketball outside.

@golddomersdulac Most of my random experiences were visiting cousin JJ while he was a student. I carried a case of beer across the entire campus, watched them poured out, one by one, by a no-fun RA. "Swam" Stonehenge fountain.

@golddomersdulac J. Swarbrick walks up under the seats I go "hey i know you!" He says "oh ya and who are you?"  "me? im nobody" and he says "not true you're  def somebody"shaking my hand-introduce myself and tell him "Nice Hire(BK 1st year)"he thanks me-talks ND football for 10 and we part ways

@golddomersdulac Golden Tate accidentally knocked on our door at TC when we were pregaming one night (think he was a freshman at time). We convinced him to come in and play a game of beer pong/flip cup with us before going on to his actual destination.

@golddomersdulac I was an 18 year old semi-drunk freshman and ran into John Lattner at the 91 Tennessee game. Repeated the line “John Lattner, you must be in the Navy”. He continued “you’re a cruiser”.
@golddomersdulac Was walking across campus one summer, saw Father Jenkins, and convinced him to take a selfie with me
@golddomersdulac Plugging in the #1 sign after FSU in 93. Unplugging it after BC.
@golddomersdulac My first trip to Notre Dame, 2001 vs. Tennessee, my friend and I were stopped by Dick Vitale. He needed directions to the Alumni Hall. I couldn’t speak.
@golddomersdulac Terry Mcfadden of WNDU thinks I played football for ND and has had two different conversations with me about the team through the years.
@golddomersdulac Spent 5 minutes talking to Zorich 10 years ago after a blue gold game.  Nobody knew who he was.  He puffed his cigar and told my kids not to smoke after he signed some stuff.

@golddomersdulac Walking Chris Collinsworth to the ticket office for his first home game.             Also, me seeing Charlie Weis on a game day.  Taking a back way to the stadium- with nobody around.   And me shouting at him to “figure it out, Charlie!”  He put his head down in disgust.

@golddomersdulac In 2014, I went to my very first ND game.  After ASU beat us horribly, my son and I stumbled upon the team bus and I got a pic with Will the thrill Fuller and talked to several others.

@golddomersdulac Encountering female fans from southern school (Mississippi) in the bathroom at a November game. Rain that became snow. They are in full length mink coats and alligator heals. They were offended by ND weather and said they had no idea. Mississippi is known for poor education!?!
@Maltier33 @golddomersdulac And @irv8284, still is. Wonderful man.
@IrishTightness @bridgetgoirish Buy the ticket. Take the ride.

@golddomersdulac After an early game we were throwing a football around the North quad. Some old guy grabbed the ball and started flinging it from BP to the N dining hall for us to catch. Then his wife came up and said: “Johnny Lujak now you are all sweaty for dinner.”  Love thee ND. 🍀🍀🍀
@IrishTightness @golddomersdulac He took a pic with my family and was really nice!
@Aimee_Lucas That’s amazing.

@golddomersdulac I have a few fun ones. When I was a manager, post-game job after 1 game was to check credentials to get into the press conf tent by the stadium. I was so focused on checking badges, I never looked at who - until I tried to stop Joe Paterno - who had no credential - from going in.
@IrishTightness https://t.co/nsd1JgtQbt
@golddomersdulac 1988 ND / Michigan game. A group of us LaPorte Slicers went to the stadium, snuck inside and ended up on the field when the Irish won.
@golddomersdulac 1992 verse Navy and I was 13. walking into the pep rally in the acc and got ran over by Irv Smith. He picked me up with one hand. Dude was huge.
@golddomersdulac Walked past Dick Vitale on the way to the port a pots a couple years ago. Have him a fist bump and said Go Irish.
@golddomersdulac BC last year me & my friends were at a local Chestnut Hill dive before the game. Ran into Victor Abriamiri and Ambrose Wooden
